posts.message:
After our beloved government contracted surveillance companies to spy on us online, it is important for us to find ways to combat this surveillance. It is not an Egyptian issue, we all know about the NSA (National Security Agency) scandal in USA and documents leaked by Edward Snowden, this made a worldwide movement to combat surveillance agencies.

Let’s share our knowledge in combating the surveillance. We all know about Tor but there is lots of great open source software which provide alternatives for untrusted widely used proprietary software.  Check this site out: http://prism-break.org/en/ and you will find alternatives you never heard about before. Keep in mind any way, if you want to have privacy, you will have to sacrifice usability and performance.
posts.caption: prism-break.org
posts.description: Opt out of global data surveillance programs like PRISM, XKeyscore and Tempora. Help make mass surveillance of entire populations uneconomical! We all have a right to privacy, which you can exercise today by encrypting your communications and ending your reliance on proprietary services.

posts.message:
Any .Net developer here experienced in Cryptography?
I'm looking for a great Cryptography library because the built in functionality in .Net is limited, for example: the BCL's implementation of PBKDF2 uses HMAC-SHA1 and I need one that uses HMAC-SHA512.
I've been searching for some time now and found a few options but the most significant ones are CryptSharp and BouncyCastle.
So I which of these is better? do you have a better recommendation?
